Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)
I think this line doesn't work because `no-warm-reboot` is removed at meta-facebook/recipes-phosphor/state/phosphor-state-manager_%.bbappend line:3
Done
Should `host-poweron@{}.service` be put into `obmc-host-startmin` instead of `obmc-host-start` ?
Done

Is this really needed when chassis-poweron? If the slot not exist then it will wait  50 sec.
Or is it better to add slot precence pin check before starting chassis-poweron?

I am not sure MCTP endpoint establish should be part of chassis-poweron? or is it possibile move to host power action as `Requires=` ?
I guess here might need a check and just return when `$1 = 0` (chassis 0).

Hi, Patrick, I've encountered an issue in YV4: When hosts are running and BMC reset, `CurrentHostState` will all be `Off`, which cause the NICs are set to aux mode incorrectly, we need to let `CurrentHostState` match to the real state when exposing them on Dbus.

According to your comments, it's seems that `obmc-chassis-powerreset` is designed for such condition, and this feature has not been implemented in YV4 yet.

Unfortunately, I haven't found any source code call this target, could you please provide any workflow of this target or hints to me for my further analysis? Thanks.
